comment._content: I attended school here, I lived 1/2 block from the school on what is now Strawberry St.

comment.author: 27651791@N08
comment._content: I also lived on Addison St. (406), a block or so away  ... now Strawberry St. I  also went to Fox as did my brother. Who are you???? We might have know each other.

comment.author: 33795238@N02
comment._content: I  use to like  that but now i am a big man who dont like lil boys to be lookin like that so let them live there lives

comment.author: 12306929@N04
comment._content:
We called them "Patrol Boys" and if you jay walked you got reported to your teacher and she then would single you out for discipline(ususally a note to mom) I was a patrol boy and only ever repoerted kids 2 or 3 times in my entire career !

In those days kids did NOT HAVE THE RIGHT-OF-WAY  but had to wait for traffic to clear !! Today the little snots walk out in front of you and if you refuse to stop you get a ticket !!!  There is no justice !!

I don't mean that we should run kids over but it seems disrespectful to the adults driving the cars, especially when the kids taunt you by running out daring you to proceed !

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called School group portrait, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment._content: Fr row looks like Daryl Silver, Wayne Sanford, unknown, Ravone Woolard  2nd row 3rd boy Bobby Christian. 3rd row 3rd boy looks like Ned Hood.

comment.author: 41739171@N08
comment._content: Looks like a reunion of neighborhood kids....I lived at 2306 Park until 1957.  I'm thinking about bringing my grandson back for the Fox Centennial.

comment.author: 55521919@N07
comment._content: Did you know that William Fox School is having a centennial celebration on November 6, 2011 from 2 to 5 p.m. at the school. Come one, come all! For more info www.WilliamFox100@gmail.com
